alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Kane; Northern Cook; Southern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 14 at 3:20AM CDT until August 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Central Cook, DuPage, Kane, Lake IL, McHenry, Northern Cook and Southern Cook. * WHEN...From 10 AM CDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rainfall will accompany showers and thunderstorms today across northeastern Illinois. Rainfall rates in excess of an inch per hour are likely with the heaviest showers, and this may lead to instances of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means rapid-onset flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Flash flooding is a dangerous situation. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Cook; DuPage; Kane; Northern Cook; Southern Cook
